result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Plea/sentencing hearing on November 17, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

10:19 AM Defendant Jacob A Becker appeared by video.  Attorney Steven Hughes in court for Jacob A Becker.  Prosecuting attorney Patrick Ryan Campbell in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Defense requests plea and sentencing date.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for November 17, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Letter to Court dated August 30, 2022 re: Request for an Adjournment or Authorization to Appear by Zoom, filed by Atty. Hughes

9:50 AM Defendant Jacob A Becker in court.  Attorney Steven Hughes in court for Jacob A Becker.  Plaintiff State of Wisconsin in court.  Attorney Zachary Wittchow in court for State of Wisconsin. The Court finds that the Defendant's waiver to a preliminary hearing is knowing and voluntary.  Waive reading of Information. NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED.
Hearing scheduled for September 7, 2022 at 09:30 am.
Defendant waives his/her right to a Preliminary Hearing. filed by Atty Hughes
Preliminary hearing on August 29, 2022 at 08:15 am.

Absolute sobriety, defendant is not to possess or consume any alcohol.  Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription and take as prescribed.  Defendant is not to use/possess any drug paraphernalia.   Defendant is not to operate a motor vehicle unless properly licensed.  Comply with all licensing restrictions.

08:50 AM Defendant Jacob A Becker in court with attorney Steven Hughes.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Defense acknowledges receipt of complaint and waives reading of complaint.  
Service admitted/advised of charges and potential penalties.  
Court advises of right to an attorney.  Defendant is eligible for State Public Defender representation.  Attorney Hughes is appointed.
Preliminary Hearing requested.  Preliminary time limits waived.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 29, 2022 at 08:15 am.
Defendant's Demand for Discovery and Inspection.
